question.body: Which of the following is directly activated by dissolved molecules once ingested?

response.feedback: Incorrect. These are the raised bumps on the tongue visible with the naked eye; they protect the receptor.
Correct. This receptor is found one of many taste buds associated with the papilla of the tongue.
Incorrect. This structure includes many receptors but also includes other support cells, so you need a more specific level of organization.
Incorrect. This is one of the sub-modalities of taste and not a structure.
Incorrect. This is stimulated by the receptor cell but cannot itself respond directly to dissolved molecules in the saliva.

part.hint: The receptor cell is not a neuron, but is protected. It responds directly to chemical stimuli and releases neurotransmitters that activate sensory neurons.
